result.execSummary:
The defendant Breanna M. Gigl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
On Count #2 of Case 21CF65, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, to be served in the prison system.  All sentences are concurrent to eachother.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breanna M. Gigl

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 4/26/2022 plea and sentencing hearing

[ma] Cases 20CF206, 20CF397,21CF289,21CF331,21CF642,22CF60,22CF65 called at 9:54am 
Defendant Breanna M. Gigl in court, in custody with Attorney Julia C Westley.  DA Monica Hall appears via zoom for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Hall is being displayed on the large monitors in the courtroom, enabling Ms. Gigl and Atty Westley to see her. 

DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; 
Plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Count #1 of Case 20CF206
Plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Count #2 of Case 20CF397
Pleas of "  GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #5 of Case 21CF289
Plea of "NO CONTEST" entered on Count #4 of Case 21CF289
Pleas of " GUILTY  " entered on Counts #1 and #6 of Case 21CF331
Pleas of " GUILTY  " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 21CF65

Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Remaining Counts and Cases, and uncharged referral

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Gigl

On Count #1 of Case 20CF206, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 1/2   years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision.
The Court gives  3   days credit for time already served.

On Count #2 of Case 20CF397, the Court sentences the Defendant to  6 1/2  years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision.  

On Count #1 of Case 21CF289, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 1/2   years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision.
The Court gives  5   days credit for time already served.

On Count #4 of Case 21CF289, the Court sentences the Defendant to 9 months jail, to be served in the prison system.

On Count #5 of Case 21CF289, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, to be served in the prison system.

On Count #1 of Case 21CF331, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 1/2   years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision.
The Court gives   54  days credit for time already served.

On Count #6 of Case 21CF331, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, to be served in the prison system.  


On Count #1 of Case 21CF65, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, to be served in the prison system.  

On Count #2 of Case 21CF65, the Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, to be served in the prison system.  

All sentences are concurrent to eachother.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.


The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating prescriber
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent, can have contact with father of children, so long as it pertains to care/placement of common children, and Agent authorizes and permits
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amounts of $50(20CF206), $250(20CF397-joint but several), $150(21CF289-joint but several), $25(21CF331-joint but several), $100(22CF60)
--to pay buy money reimbursement in the amounts of $120(20CF206), $80.36(21CF331-joint but several)


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:12am

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Letter request to transfer defendant to ARC program.
Court's Order re: Bond Modification
Letter to court re Defendant
Letter from national expert physician
Letter to court from Atty Westley
Letter from regional expert physician
Letter from ARC
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #20CF206, #20CF397, #21CF289, #21CF331, #21CF642, #22CF60, #22CF65 called at 1:50pm
Defendant Breanna M Gigl appears in court, in custody, Attorney Julie C Westley.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Cases  #21CF642, #22CF60, #22CF65 Preliminary Hearing-Waiver and Arraignment is held:  
---Ms. Gigl waives her right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
---service of Informations admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
---pleas of "not guilty" are entered
---in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trials.

As to all cases, the Court addresses Bond: 
---arguments given by counsel 
---the Court requires Attorney Westley to submit a letter from the treating physician by Monday [4/11/22] at 4:00pm 
recess 2:30pm

NEXT:  (1) the Defense 4/5/22 Motion to Modify Bond remains pending,  (2) the current FSSC/Jury Trial scheduling in the cases #20CF206 and #20CF397 remains in place,  (3) schedule the other cases for Status Conference on the 4/26/22 date/time
This is ok
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 20CF206, 20CF397, 21CF289, 21CF331, 21CF642, 22CF60, and 22CF65 called at 1:23PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Breanna M. Gigl appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Julia C Westley appears. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the Zoom connection is sight and sound sufficient.
DA Hall verifies Victim rights Compliance.

DA Hall reviews the Court record as it relates to the Defendant's bond and Court appearance record.
DA Hall requests that the Court set Cash Bond in files 22CF60 and 22CF65, and that set Cash Bonds in the other files remain the same.
Att Westley requests that any outstanding warrants be quashed. The Court quashes any outstanding warrant in the above files.

The Court declines to modify bond in any of the above files.

The Court sets these matters over for 04/07 at 1:30PM, replacing the scheduled Bail Bond hearing with Prelims and Statuses for the above files.

recess 1:33PM

NEXT: 
In files 22CF65, 22CF60, and 20CF642: Preliminary Hearings (all other files to track along for Status) on 04/07 at 1:30PM
Extradition Forecast

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #20CF206, #20CF397, #21CF289, #21CF331, #21CF642, 22CF60, #22CF65 called at 8:59am, and then at 9:14am.  
Defendant Breanna M Gigl does not appear. Attorney Julie C Westley appears.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases #22CF60and #22CF65 are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today and the State's detective-witnesses are present.  The remaining cases are scheduled for Status Conference.
Attorney Westley indicates that she has not been able to contact Ms. Gigl this morning. 
On Motion of the State, the Court issues Warrants for the arrest of Ms. Gigl in each case. 
The Court finds the Bonds to be in default. 
recess 9:15am. 
[Post-hearing: the Court indicates to the clerk that future scheduling in the cases should remain on the Court's calendar at this point]

NEXT:  schedule Bail Forfeiture Hearing ($250 posted cash bail) in Case #21CF642
State's Notice of Motion for Bond to be Found in Default and Have the Court Issue a Warrant
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include needles
--no contact with Devin Vogel (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--Ms. Gigl is to report to the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts Office by 4:00pm today to sign the Bond

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #20CF206, #20CF397, #21CF289, #21CF331, #21CF642, 22CF60, #22CF65 called at 9:00am.  
Defendant Breanna M Gigl appears.  Attorney Julie C Westley appears.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the Zoom video-connection is sight and sound sufficient.  
_______________
Initial Appearances are held in Cases #22CF60 and #22CF65:   
--Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Preliminary Hearings will be scheduled within the time limit, as requested by the Defense. 
--The Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond in each case, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include needles
--no contact with Devin Vogel 
--Ms. Gigl is to report to the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts Office by 4:00pm today to sign the Bond 
 ______________
As to the State's Motion for Bond Modification in Cases #20CF206, #20CF397, #21CF289, #21CF331:
--arguments are given by counsel
--the Court requires Cash Bonds of $1,000 Cash in case #20CF206;  of $500 Cash in Case #20CF397, of $1,500 Case in Case #21CF289, and of $500 Cash in Case #21CF331. The special conditions of the Bonds are unchanged; they remain in full force and effect. The Court requires that Ms. Gigl must post the cash amounts and sign the Amended Bonds by 4:30pm today.    
recess 9:24am 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing in Cases #22CF60 and #22CF65, and Status Conference in the other cases--all  on March 1st at 9:00am
Initial appearance on February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
